text.p: These are the leading stories in the Lebanese press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Prime Minister Hariri: Cabinet to discuss new parliamentary election law.
- Central bank's gross foreign exchange reserves up $62.15 million.
- Opposition gathering and sit-in today to protest against the arrest of anti-government leader Elias Abou Risk.
- Israeli forces shell south Lebanon areas.
- Six Lebanese workers and three Syrians die in car accident on the Lebanese-Syrian border.
- Banking shares rally on Beirut Stock Exchange.
- Some 180 evacuees return to Lebanon from Sierra Leone.
- Treasury bill issue of May 29 raises 329.5 billion Lebanese pounds.
- Resistance fighters ambush South Lebanon Army militiamen.
